) TAS Systemic Advocacy (SA) oversees the Systemic Advocacy Management System (SAMS). Both internal (e.g., IRS employees) and external (e.g., and taxpayers) submitters can use SAMS to report systemic issues that impact taxpayers. The issues put on SAMS are reviewed by employees in Systemic Issue Review & Evaluation (SIRE) group. The goal is resolve the systemic issue (problem), and this often involves recommendations to IRS procedures and processes. (

) SA has established several management reviews to assess program ness. One review is the periodic monthly review of the work done by a Management program analyst in SIRE. The second review is the weekly review of all Review issues by a SAMS Program Manager in SIRE. Finally, a third review is the weekly closed issue review completed by a cross-functional team of TAS offices. (

) The Chief, SIRE, along with the SAMS Program Manager(s), prepare a list each week of issues on SAMS that are ready for ﬁnal review and closing.
